Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Convert SdbData types to readonly structs" (#477) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This is for performance (also cleans up some old code) that reduces the allocations used when loading the schema constraint data. Previously new objects were loaded for each of the items (which are thousands). This changes it to use structs instead of objects, which greatly reduces the memory allocated.

master:
```
       Method |         Mean |         Error |        StdDev |     Gen 0 |     Gen 1 |    Gen 2 |   Allocated |
------------- |-------------:|--------------:|--------------:|----------:|----------:|---------:|------------:|
       Create |    160.83 us |     3.1316 us |     4.1806 us |   44.1895 |         - |        - |    68.01 KB |
 CreateNoSave |     49.63 us |     0.6315 us |     0.5907 us |   16.5405 |         - |        - |    25.42 KB |
     ReadFile |  2,040.06 us |    31.1776 us |    29.1635 us |  312.5000 |   78.1250 |        - |   730.92 KB |
   Validation | 86,703.67 us | 1,587.5713 us | 1,485.0151 us | 4750.0000 | 1000.0000 | 250.0000 | 16155.36 KB |
     LoadData | 18,744.22 us |   367.6242 us |   393.3538 us |  531.2500 |  218.7500 |  62.5000 |  2988.81 KB |
```

with change:

```
       Method |         Mean |       Error |      StdDev |     Gen 0 |     Gen 1 |    Gen 2 |   Allocated |
------------- |-------------:|------------:|------------:|----------:|----------:|---------:|------------:|
       Create |    156.42 us |   1.7637 us |   1.6498 us |   44.1895 |         - |        - |    68.01 KB |
 CreateNoSave |     50.22 us |   0.9710 us |   0.9083 us |   16.5405 |         - |        - |    25.42 KB |
     ReadFile |  2,013.20 us |  19.1713 us |  17.9329 us |  312.5000 |   78.1250 |        - |   730.92 KB |
   Validation | 86,429.49 us | 786.2571 us | 656.5602 us | 4562.5000 | 1062.5000 | 312.5000 | 16015.66 KB |
     LoadData | 10,145.91 us | 171.3562 us | 160.2867 us |  328.1250 |  171.8750 |  46.8750 |  1874.71 KB |
```

There is also a perf gain in the time it takes to load all the data by about 43%, and a reduction of allocations by 38%

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Convert SdbData types to readonly structs" (#477) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This is for performance (also cleans up some old code) that reduces the allocations used when loading the schema constraint data. Previously new objects were loaded for each of the items (which are thousands). This changes it to use structs instead of objects, which greatly reduces the memory allocated.

Before:


```
      Method |         Mean |      Error |     StdDev |     Gen 0 |    Gen 1 |    Gen 2 |   Allocated |
------------- |-------------:|-----------:|-----------:|----------:|---------:|---------:|------------:|
       Create |    171.09 us |   3.403 us |   8.784 us |   44.1895 |        - |        - |    68.01 KB |
 CreateNoSave |     51.27 us |   1.009 us |   1.919 us |   16.4795 |        - |        - |    25.42 KB |
     ReadFile |  2,150.45 us | 208.723 us | 214.343 us |  316.4063 |  82.0313 |        - |   730.98 KB |
   Validation | 83,571.12 us | 963.987 us | 854.550 us | 4250.0000 | 875.0000 | 250.0000 | 16154.99 KB |
     LoadData | 18,009.41 us | 356.916 us | 333.859 us |  531.2500 | 218.7500 |  62.5000 |  2988.76 KB |
```

After:

```
       Method |         Mean |         Error |        StdDev |     Gen 0 |     Gen 1 |    Gen 2 |   Allocated |
------------- |-------------:|--------------:|--------------:|----------:|----------:|---------:|------------:|
       Create |    158.50 us |     3.0523 us |     2.3830 us |   44.1895 |         - |        - |    68.01 KB |
 CreateNoSave |     50.12 us |     0.8219 us |     0.7286 us |   16.5405 |         - |        - |    25.42 KB |
     ReadFile |  2,057.23 us |    34.3426 us |    30.4438 us |  300.7813 |   78.1250 |        - |   730.82 KB |
   Validation | 89,500.56 us | 1,776.7142 us | 2,371.8624 us | 4562.5000 | 1062.5000 | 312.5000 | 16016.65 KB |
     LoadData | 10,323.75 us |   196.4410 us |   311.5763 us |  328.1250 |  171.8750 |  46.8750 |  1874.91 KB |
```

There is also a perf gain in the time it takes to load all the data by about 43%, although validation increased about 6%, but the standard deviation there is larger.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add tests for SdbData types" (#475) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "adding strongly typed methods to OpenXmlReader fixes #398" (#476) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This implements the request I made in #398.

* I dropped the word `Current` as it is additional fluff of a word - the property is `ElementType` so i deemed it unnecessary 
* Made the methods virtual since this is an abstract class for backwards compatibility.
* Added one resource string.
* Added test coverage.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add tests for SdbData types" (#475) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "Add initial benchmark class" (#474) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This adds some tests to get benchmarks for performance tracking using [BenchmarkDotNet](http://benchmarkdotnet.org/). The output for these tests on .NET 4.7.1 (on my desktop):

```
      Method |         Mean |      Error |     StdDev |     Gen 0 |    Gen 1 |    Gen 2 |   Allocated |
------------- |-------------:|-----------:|-----------:|----------:|---------:|---------:|------------:|
       Create |    171.09 us |   3.403 us |   8.784 us |   44.1895 |        - |        - |    68.01 KB |
 CreateNoSave |     51.27 us |   1.009 us |   1.919 us |   16.4795 |        - |        - |    25.42 KB |
     ReadFile |  2,150.45 us | 208.723 us | 214.343 us |  316.4063 |  82.0313 |        - |   730.98 KB |
   Validation | 83,571.12 us | 963.987 us | 854.550 us | 4250.0000 | 875.0000 | 250.0000 | 16154.99 KB |
     LoadData | 18,009.41 us | 356.916 us | 333.859 us |  531.2500 | 218.7500 |  62.5000 |  2988.76 KB |
```

Some tasks, such as validation (which the LoadData is a subset of) consume a lot of memory. Using this data, we can have some direction to make the SDK more efficient.

@tomjebo

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add initial benchmark class" (#474) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This adds some tests to get benchmarks for performance tracking using [BenchmarkDotNet](http://benchmarkdotnet.org/)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove IReadOnlyList implementation from SdbDataArray" (#473) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: There's no need to abstract it, and this will remove any virtual calls which can add up for performance reasons.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove IReadOnlyList implementation from SdbDataArray" (#473) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: There's no need to abstract it, and this will remove any virtual calls which can add up for performance reasons.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Allow HtmlToWmlConverterCore to recognize the "text-align" css property" (#218) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
I working on a project where I have to convert an html file into a word document and insert it into a bigger word document.

During the process I noticed that the code was not recognizing when the css property "text-align" was set, and because o that the text was never changing it's align.

My change consist in fixing it so the code will be able to recognize the "text-align" attribute.

What I basicaly did is:
Capturing every css atribute that is set in the HTML, and adding to the standard library of css properties with a foreach loop.

I'm creating this pull request to try to improve the code, if I did it wrong please let me know
There are some auto corrections made by the visual studio, don't mind it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to run any PowerShell Cmdlets" (#143) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
I am really struggling here.
I cloned both Open-XML-SDK and Open-XML-PowerTools.
I compiled the Open-XML-SDK
I tried 
`Import-Module .\Open-XML-PowerTools.psm1` and I get:
> Add-Type : Cannot bind parameter 'Path' to the target. Exception setting "Path": "Cannot find path 'C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-Sdk\DocumentFormat.OpenXml\bin\debug\System.IO.Packaging.dll' because it does not exist."
> At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\AddTypes.ps1:69 char:16. -Type -Path "$PSScriptRoot\..\Open-Xml-Sdk\DocumentFormat.OpenXml\bin ...
> CategoryInfo          : WriteError: (:) [Add-Type], ParameterBindingException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : ParameterBindingFailed,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.AddTypeCommand
> 
> Add-Type : (0) : Metadata file 'C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\..\Open-Xml-Sdk\DocumentFormat.OpenXml\bin\debug\System.IO.Packaging.dll' could not be found
> At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\AddTypes.ps1:70 char:1
> Add-Type -ReferencedAssemblies $assemblies -Path $sources -OutputAsse ...
>  CategoryInfo          : InvalidData: (Microsoft.Power...peCompilerError:AddTypeCompilerError) [Add-Type], Exception FullyQualifiedErrorId : SOURCE_CODE_ERROR,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.AddTypeCommand
> Add-Type : Cannot add type. Compilation errors occurred.
> At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\AddTypes.ps1:70 char:1
> Add-Type -ReferencedAssemblies $assemblies -Path $sources -OutputAsse ...
>  CategoryInfo          : InvalidData: (:) [Add-Type], InvalidOperationException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : COMPILER_ERRORS,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.AddTypeCommand

I fixed the paths by adding "\net46\ to the debug dll locations in AddTypes.ps1 Now the Import-Module works without error. When I try any cmdlet like the example:
`New-Docx Out-2.docx -Comment`
I get:

> New-Object : Cannot find type [System.Collections.Generic.List[OpenXmlPowerTools.Source]]: verify that the assembly containing this type is loaded.
> At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\Cmdlets\New-Docx.ps1:303 char:16   $srcList = New-Object 'System.Collections.Generic.List[OpenXmlPowerT ...
> CategoryInfo          : InvalidType: (:) [New-Object], PSArgumentException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : TypeNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.NewObjectCommand
> 
> New-Object : Cannot find type [OpenXmlPowerTools.WmlDocument]: verify that the assembly containing this type is loaded. At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\Cmdlets\New-Docx.ps1:404 char:13
> $wml = (New-Object OpenXmlPowerTools.WmlDocument("DummyName.docx" ...
> CategoryInfo          : InvalidType: (:) [New-Object], PSArgumentException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : TypeNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.NewObjectCommand
> 
> New-Object : Cannot find type [OpenXmlPowerTools.Source]: verify that the assembly containing this type is loaded. At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\Cmdlets\New-Docx.ps1:411 char:17
> $src = (New-Object OpenXmlPowerTools.Source($wml))
> CategoryInfo          : InvalidType: (:) [New-Object], PSArgumentException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : TypeNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.NewObjectCommand
> 
> You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
> At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\Cmdlets\New-Docx.ps1:413 char:5
> $srcList.Add($src)
> 
> CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull
> 
> Unable to find type [OpenXmlPowerTools.DocumentBuilder]. At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\Cmdlets\New-Docx.ps1:351 char:26
> $mergedWmlDocument = [OpenXmlPowerTools.DocumentBuilder]::BuildDo ...
> CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (OpenXmlPowerTools.DocumentBuilder:TypeName) [], RuntimeException FullyQualifiedErrorId : TypeNotFound
> 
> You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
> At C:\Users\ruby\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools\Cmdlets\New-Docx.ps1:385 char:13
> $mergedWmlDocument.SaveAs($outputFi.FullName)
> CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
> FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull
> 

Does the PowerShell work for anyone? I just want to use the project. I have spent several hours on and off trying to get this to work. Any help will be greatly appreciated.

Even better...can I get an "Install-Module" option so I don't have to build it all myself?
